com.camerontec.catalys.server.collection

Class CollectionRegistryService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.server.collection.CollectionRegistryService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IService, ICollectionRegistry

    public final class CollectionRegistryService
extends Object
implements ICollectionRegistry, IService
    Service based ICollectionRegistry implementation which handles delegation to a default and (optionally) a custom ICollectionRegistry implementation.

    • Field Detail

      • SERVICE_NAME

        public static final String SERVICE_NAME
        The well known collection registry service name.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CUSTOM_SERVICE_NAME

        public static final String CUSTOM_SERVICE_NAME
        The custom collection registry service name.

        Before creating any new collection the default collection registry implementation (that is, the implementation registered with the ServiceRegistry as SERVICE_NAME) guarantees to first delegate to a custom ICollectionRegistry implementation registered as a service with this name if it exists. Therefore, it is possible plug in custom collections by creating a custom ICollectionRegistry implementation and registering it with the ServiceRegistry with this service name. The general contract of the customer ICollectionRegistry is that:

        • It is delegated to by the default collection registry and therefore has access to the same Properties as the default collection registry
        • If the custom registry chooses to provide an implementation it does so, otherwise it returns null, in which case the call is automatically handled by the default collection registry
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • getList

        public <E> List<E> getList(String name,
                           Properties properties,
                           Class<E> elementClass)
                    throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: ICollectionRegistry
        Return a named list from the registry, creating and inserting one if none exists.

        This variant assumes the element class may be externalized by one of the built in externalizers, or is java.io.Serializable. If custom externalization is required use ICollectionRegistry.getList(String, Properties, com.camerontec.util.io.IBytesSegmentExternalizer) instead.

        Lists may be either standard or high capacity. The caller may choose by optionally specifying the CollectionProperties.IS_HIGH_CAPACITY_LIST property.

        Lists do not currently support in memory element caching.

        Specified by:
        getList in interface ICollectionRegistry
        Type Parameters:
        E - The element type.
        Parameters:
        name - the list's name - this name has to be unique across all collections managed by this registry
        properties - The list properties.
        elementClass - The element class.
        Returns:
        The named list.
        Throws:
        IOException - On error creating a new list.

      • getMap

        public <K,V> Map<K,V> getMap(String name,
                             Properties properties,
                             Class<K> keyClass,
                             Class<V> valueClass)
                      throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: ICollectionRegistry
        Return a named map from the registry, creating and inserting one if none exists.

        This variant assumes the element class may be externalized by one of the built-in externalizer, or is java.io.Serializable. If custom externalization is required use ICollectionRegistry.getMap(String, Properties, IBytesSegmentExternalizer, IBytesSegmentExternalizer, Map) instead.

        We assume that caching is enabled by default. Should any one need to disable caching explicitly using this method, set the property CollectionProperties.IS_CACHING_ENABLED to false in the supplied properties parameter.

        By default the cache implementation used is BoundedLRUCache. If this implementation is not sufficient a custom cache may be used by calling ICollectionRegistry.getMap(String, Properties, IBytesSegmentExternalizer, IBytesSegmentExternalizer, Map) instead.

        There is no concept of a high capacity map.

        Specified by:
        getMap in interface ICollectionRegistry
        Type Parameters:
        K - The key type.
        V - The value type.
        Parameters:
        name - the map's name - this name has to be unique across all collections managed by this registry
        properties - The map properties.
        keyClass - Class of the key in the map.
        valueClass - Class of the value in the map
        Returns:
        The named Map with the specified types.
        Throws:
        IOException - On error creating a new map.

      • close

        public void close(String name)
           throws IllegalArgumentException,
                  IOException
        Description copied from interface: ICollectionRegistry
        Closes the collection of the specified name, allowing underlying resources to be freed.

        If the specified collection is already closed, then this call will have no effect.

        A collection should never be used after being closed. Doing this has unspecified effects.

        Specified by:
        close in interface ICollectionRegistry
        Parameters:
        name - Name of collection to close.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If there is nothing bound to the given name in the registry.
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs when releasing some resource used by the collection

      • closeAll

        public void closeAll()
              throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: ICollectionRegistry
        Closes all the collections bound to this registry that are not already closed.

        A collection should never be used after being closed. Doing this has unspecified effects.

        Specified by:
        closeAll in interface ICollectionRegistry
        Throws:
        IOException - If an I/O error occurs when releasing some resource used by a collection
        See Also:
        ICollectionRegistry.close(String)
